column1: a peach to begin. Squares Tamim up with a raging outswinger, full and outside off stump
length and curved away from the corridor, blocked on the front foot
slashed over point! With some gusto. Boult drops it short outside off, Tamim springs onto that and doesn't bother keeping it down. Lovely start to his tour
length and into leg stump, nudged behind square on the leg side
length ball pushed across the corridor, left alone
length in the corridor, blocked on the front foot
length ball in the corridor, solidly forward to defend into the leg side
length on leg stump, leans into that and closes the face at the perfect moment to flick this past square leg
length and just outside off, defended on the back foot
short of a length at middle stump, tucked to square leg's left with soft hands to steal a run
short of a length and rising in the corridor, left alone
length in the corridor, left alone

squares him again and nearly takes off stump! What a delivery that is. Tamim's done superbly to not get an outside edge on that, but to be honest, he had no chance. This swung away starting from middle and off and he closed the face on it
length and some shape away from off stump, steered to third man's left off the front foot
length and across off stump, leans in on the front foot pat, gets it through the covers
full and shaped into off stump, just enough to encumber his attempted cover drive. It comes off the inside part of the bat and rolls out to cover
bouncer a bit too short, he ducks to let it go
spits past the outside edge. A length ball in the corridor, looks to defend close to the body but that seams and rises steeply
length at off stump, defended down the pitch
good length on leg stump, looks to flick, deflected off his thight
short of a length outside off, handsome punch off the back foot, straight to point
short of a length outside off, pulled to fine leg's left, nice swivel and a roll of the wrists
short of a length in the corridor, gets on top of that and whips to square leg
good length and in the corridor, blocked on the front foot
good length outside off, leans in on the front foot, thick outside edge down to third man

this looks plumb! And Tamim walks off. Full and straight, the same delivery, on line, that he's been swinging away from Tamim the first ball of his last two overs. This one goes straight on with the angle and pins him in front of middle as he looks to flick from the corridor - which is where the ball had been swinging to the last few instances. This is either a genius set up or natural variation coming into play. With Boult, you could bank on the former
length and into the stumps, clipped to midwicket from the crease
full outswinger in the corridor, defended into the covers

taken at cover. That is soft from Soumya. Short of a length and rising in the corridor. Hardly any room for the slash that he's attempted. It gets big on him and lobs up for Conway who takes a few strides backwards to hold on. A promising start has been wrecked in this over
short and rising at the throat, defended into the pitch with the bottom hand off
good length and curved down leg side, a stunning one-handed take from Latham
good length and threatening to shape back into the corridor before it holds its line to beat his forward defence

dropped at first slip. Latham's right arm has unsighted him. Length ball holds its line at off stump, looks to defend, big edge headed straight to slip. Latham goes one-handed and can't get a touch on it. Mitchell can't get his hands around it
length outside off, jabbed into the off side
kicks up from off stump and short of a good length, hurriedly off his glove into the leg side
length and into off stump, defended on the front foot
full and just outside off, half a stride out and opens the face to get this drive past cover. Neesham pulls it in with a slide, running back from point
good length outside off, blocked on the front foot
good length and slanted across the corridor, leans in and opens the face to run this between point and cover
length on off, defended down the pitch
good length on middle stump, defended off the back foot
length on leg stump, pushed into the leg side on the front foot
good length on off stump, solidly defended on the front foot
short of a length at off stump, defended to point
full and at off stump, tapped back to the bowler on the bounce
short of a length and bobbling away in the corridor, left alone
short of a length and jagging back in. Big appeal for catch behind but that has come off the thigh guard
an lbw appeal this time, Rahim is trapped in the crease to an incoming delivery. In front of off but that is climbing above
length and into the stumps, looks for a drive, hard hands. Thick inside edge towards fine leg
oh gorgeous. Short of a length at middle stump, onto his toes and gently tucked in front of square leg from his hips
length outside off, left alone
jumps past the outside edge. It's a tough life so far today for Rahim. Length ball jumps up and he chases with his hands
and again. Short of a length and rising. Withdraws the bat late this time
good length and in the corridor, left alone
short of a length across the corridor, left alone
short of a length at off stump, defends a tad aerially off the back foot. Down towards third man
just short of second slip. Good length at off stump, defends with soft hands as this straigthens
length and wobbly in the corridor, pushes hard on the drive, thick outside edge to third man
length and in at middle stump, thick inside edge into the leg side as he takes his bottom hand off the bat
full and honing in at off stump, mistimed drive into the covers
short of a length outside off, drops the arms to let that go
good length on off stump, defended solidly on the back foot
swished past point. Overpitched and wide. Liton goes with his hands and slices at a catchable height. But it is between cover and point
yorker length outside off, beaten as he looks to chop that square
full and into middle stump, uses the angle to pat this wide of mid-on. Boult dives to the right to keep that in the circle
beaten. Goes chasing as this jags away from outside off. Was looking to defend for the angle into him
oh beauty. Slams it at a length in the corridor, angled into Rahim but holding its line to beat the outside edge
good length and cramped at off stump, defends late and nearly onto the stumps. That bounces away from off
short-arm pull over the leg-side infield. Short of a length and slanted into him, doesn't look to keep the pull down, but it's only a chip in the end
length and wide outside off, left alone
overpitched on leg stump, can't get his drive wide of mid-on
short of a length and wide outside off, left alone
past the edge. Straightens after landing at a length in the corridor
full at middle stump, driven straight to mid-on
length and into leg stump, dropped into the leg side off the front foot
short of a length and climbing in the corridor. Caught inside the line of this on the back foot
length on leg stump, defended into the leg side
short of a length and past the outside edge as he plays for the angle into him
short of a length and into the body. Defended solidly on the back foot
short and at the ribs, defended on the back foot
slashed to the right of gully. Short of a length outside off and his cut was briefly aerial

lobbed straight to mid-on! He is disappointed with himself. Yet another promising Liton Das innings has ended softly. On this occasion, it wasn't his usual dashing self before the wicket. He'd looked solid, got himself in in tough conditions, but has ended up getting a leading edge trying to turn one off his hips. That was at middle stump, short of a length, and he closed the face on it too soon
short of a length at middle, he closes the face on it early as well, but this lands pitch side
good length and wide outside off, left alone
good length and wide outside off, left alone
short of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot with soft hands
full and into the pads. Leans in and clips smoothly in front of square
rapidly past the bat and off stump. Length ball slanted in from wide of off stump, Rahim with static feet, slashing inside the line of that
full inswinger at off stump, waits on it and punches past mid-off
full and into the stumps, defended into the off side
length and into the stumps, defended off the back foot
good length and into middle stump, patted down the pitch
short of a length in the corridor, dead-batted into the off side
yorker length at middle stump, stabbed out towards mid-on
full at middle stump, defended to mid-on
nicely put away. Only the fourth boundary of the innings. This is overpitched and he gets a nice stride, punches firmly, and gets it over the infield on the bounce
length at the stumps, defended from the crease
length and into the stumps, turned into the leg side with the angle
length at off stump, defended down the pitch
length and into the corridor, reaches out and steers to third man off the front foot
inside edge as he pushes away from the body on the front foot. That swung in from outside off, ends up at fine leg
good length and straightening from off, stabbed to third man
short of a length outside off, left alone
length at off stump, defended on the front foot
full at middle and off, clipped to mid-on
back of a length outside off, 131kph, leans back and late cuts towards gully
pushes this one down the leg side...and the wide call is changed to a no-ball
cracked through the off side...full outside off, down on the back knee and square drives with power
pulls the length back on off stump, defended...Neesham a little frustrated
good length outside off, 133kph, left alone
on the back foot, defends to the off side
back of a length at off stump, 132kph, played towards square leg
a shorter delivery, defended down by his feet and just has to watch that it doesn't bobble back towards the stumps
tight on off stump, 136kph, defended
touch fuller, he gets a small stride forward and defends towards point
beaten by a back-of-a-length delivery that shapes back in
a short ball outside off, doesn't quite get up, sways out of the line. A very good set from Jamieson as he completes a maiden
goes after this, excellent shot, touch short from Neesham and Mushfiqur goes up and over point with the cut
back on a full length at off stumps, walks forward into a defensive push
banged in short, he rolls his wrists on a pull well in front of square
pulled through midwicket, not quite timed, was back of a length and came high off the bat
fuller at off stump, defended
that's very short, sails over his head, and called wide
left alone outside off
round the wicket, full at the stumps, driven to cover
very full, dug out and driven down the ground to long-off
slides into the pads and nudged into the leg side
worked off the pads towards square leg
fuller, angled in at middle and leg, played to the on side
an arm ball, defended on the back foot to the off side
taken at gully! Neesham bags his second. A short-of-a-length delivery outside off, goes for the cut but he's cramped for room, comes off the splice and it's a neat catch at head height
that's sharp...a short ball over off stump, Mahmudullah sways out of the line
back of a length outside off, left alone
goes back on the stumps and plays this into the leg side
another bouncer, he ducks underneath
short of a length outside off, defended square towards point
moves outside leg stump, taps this off the pads backward of square
nicely bowled, this gripped and straightened. Takes a leading edge as he looks to work to the leg side
on off stump, again a hint of turn, defended to short third man
dragged down short, he misses the pull, gets the wide call
back outside off stump, square drives to backward point
full at off stump, driven just wide of a diving cover
full at middle and leg, driven to cover
back of a length outside off, pushed square into the off side
run out backing up! What a way to go. Mahmudullah drives a full delivery firmly straight down the pitch, Neesham gets a fingertip on it, cannons into the non-striker's stumps and Mithun is stranded
back of a length at off stump, 132kph, defended
a very short bouncer
on off stump, played off the back foot to the on side
full outside off, driven onto the covers
full at off stump, defended back to the bowler
full and straight, sweetly flicked off the pads but well fielded at square leg
short of a length, defended on his toes to the off side
full at off stump, 133kph, defended
full again, driven back to the bowler
full at middle and off, tight line, defended
gets across the stumps and works to midwicket. Henry returns with a maiden
direct hit, but think he's safe...came forward to a full delivery, pushed towards mid-off and set off straightaway. He's well home as Henry hits. A bonus run from the ricochet
a yorker just outside off, jabbed to backward point
short outside off, through to the keeper
full at off stump, pushed to the bowler
ducks underneath a short ball
full at the stumps, tucked to long leg
short of a length, hops behind the line and fends to the on side
outside off, he leans back and angles wide of gully down to third man
angled into the hip, glances off the thigh pad towards square leg
full at middle and off, forced into midwicket with a straight bat
a short delivery, straight, the bottom hand comes off the bat as he tries to work it around the corner but can't beat square leg
good length at off stump, 138kph, defended off the inner part of the bat to the leg side. The squeeze continues
full at middle and leg, clipped to short midwicket
bowled round his legs! Goes too far across the stumps, this slides past the pads and flicks leg stump. Mehidy can't quite believe how he managed that
lunges forward at his first ball, blocks to the off side
how's that! Well, there's some aggression. First runs with a massive six. Charges down the pitch and launches this miles over wide long-off...94 metres
tossed up, full and straight, tapped to the on side
very full at off stump, driven along the ground to deep cover
short of a length, angled across outside off, rises through to Latham as Mahedi drops his hands
lovely bowling! This is a touch fuller, sliding across and beats the outside edge...not sure Mahedi quite pulled his bat away in time
short again, defended down by his feet
another good delivery, touch of extra bounce from around off stump, he does well to keep it down towards third man
short of a length outside off, he heaves a pull through midwicket and it's timed well enough
goes full outside off, driven sweetly and firmly into the pitch and it bounces to cover
full at off stump, defended on the front foot
wider outside off, driven through point to the sweeper
a shorter delivery, into the pads, worked behind square
moves outside leg, Santner follows him and it's played to short fine leg
clips a full delivery off his toes to the leg side
touch shorter outside off, square cuts and Boult does well from backward point with a dive
a beauty! That's too good. On off stump, nips away to beat the outside edge
full at the stumps, gets squared up as he defends and it runs off a thick outside edge along the ground to gully
a well-directed bouncer over middle and off, he sways out of the line
short, down the leg side, goes for the hook and gets something on this just out of the reach of Latham
good length outside off, left alone
comes round the wicket, extra bounce from back of a length, Mahmudullah whips his bottom hand off the bat
works a straight delivery towards square leg for a sharp single

well taken by mid-on running back! Tried to go down the ground again. Came down the pitch, was a shorter delivery, came off the splice of the bat and looped in the air. The experience of Santner shining through there
length and drifted into leg stump, tickled through square leg off the front foot
length at off stump, blocked on the front foot
length outside off, pushed into the off side on the front foot
length and slowed down outside off, pushed into the covers on the front foot
short of a length outside off, chopped down to third man
nearly sneaks through with a yorker. That dips in late at off stump but he manages to keep it out
short of cover. Length ball gets big on him and he defends with hard hands as he hops
short of a length in the corridor, defended to point
appeal for catch behind is shut down pretty quickly with a wide call. Full and down leg side
length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
length and down leg side, left alone
short and in the corridor, defended off the back foot
arm ball at a length in the corridor, punched into the covers
length and just outside off, punched to cover
length at middle, punched to long-on off the back foot
length on off stump, punched back to the bowler
tossed up at a length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length outside off, defended to cover
full outside off, shuffles and flicks to deep square's left
short and just outside off, cut on the bounce to point
full at middle stump, driven to mid-on's left
length and at the stumps, flicked to mid-on
bouncer down leg side, left alone
length on off stump, defended down the pitch
full at middle stump, flicked to midwicket with the turn
length outside off, defended into the covers
length outside off, attempted slog lands well short of long-on
tossed up at middle stump, can't get this drive past Young's dive to the left at midwicket
length on leg stump, glanced to deep backward square
length at off stump, defended down the pitch
length at off stump, defended on the back foot
length at off stump, defended from the crease
bouncer down leg side, left alone
length outside off, looks to drive on the rise but that gets too big on him
length on leg stump, flicked to fine leg
short at leg stump, defended off the back foot
length at middle stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
short and wide outside off, beaten on the cut. A knuckle ball that drifted away
length at off, punched to extra cover
length on off, defended off the back foot
length and turning into off, flicked into the leg side
past the outside edge. A carrom ball, this one lands at a length just outside off, draws him forward and beats him
length and tucking him up at middle stump
short of a length outside off, steered to third man
bouncer outside off, left alone
short and cramped at the body, takes his eyes off it as he pats it down into the pitch

just short of point. A steep bouncer that hits his glove and then pings off the helmet into the off side. Not sure it would have been out, his hand seemed to be off the bat when it was hit. In any case, he's safe - on his feet and concussion test passed
length at off stump, defended off the back foot
pumps it over the long-on boundary! Regal from Mahmudullah. Jumps down the pitch and uses the angle to launch this length ball off the middle
short of a length at off, defended off the back foot
short of a length at the hips, tucked into the leg side off the inside edge via thigh guard
short of a length outside off, hooked into the turf to deep square
length and pushed across, looks to slash through cover and is beaten
nicely played. Short of a length and just outside off, gets on his toes to cover the bounce and punches in front of point
full and into the stumps, thick inside edge trickles to deep square's right
bouncer at an off stump line, sways away and drops the bat to let that go

pummels it but to midwicket That is a sharp catch from Santner, timing his jump perfectly. This was a superbly timed pull, picking up a short of a length delivery from outside off. Santner goes up with two hands and lands well. Henry has a wicket, at last
full and at the stumps, defended into the off side
short and at the ribs, fenced down to fine leg
oh, sweet. Pictureque punch to beat mid-off to the right. Length ball outside off, just offered the full face and timed perfectly to get it on the rise
short and in the corridor, beaten on the cut
short and across the corridor, left alone
short of a length in the corridor, drops the bat to let that go
length at middle stump, backs away and has a slog at that. It rises over middle stump as it beats him
top of off. Length ball at middle and off, goes past the outside edge as he looks to block on the front foot
nearly run out at the non-striker's. Yorker at middle stump, jammed to square leg's right and he can't get the direct hit

taken at mid-on and that is the innings done. Full and into middle and leg. Leans in and tries to flick into the leg side. But it looks lie a slower one and he's through it too soon. Leading edge hangs up nicely for the fielder and that is four for Boult
angled across outside off on a good length, left alone
full outside off, big stride forward and firmly driven to cover
in the channel outside off, through to the keeper
full and straight, gets a thick inside edge into his pads as he comes forward
and he's away, in style...a bottom-handed punch over mid-on to a full delivery, strong wrists
all the way this time! A length ball into the pads, Guptill flicks it over deep square leg
over the wicket, short of a length outside off, punched through point off the back foot
hammered! He's in the mood. Short of a length outside off, a dismissive pull over wide mid-on
fuller outside off, he chases this with a big drive and doesn't make contact
short of a length, nips back considerably off the seam, takes Guptill high on the thigh pad
he's peppering the rope...full outside off, a stride forward and lofts it over mid-off. Just short of six
full at off stump, slides off the face through backward point to third man
full at the stumps, defended
length ball angling across, runs it down to third man
nicely bowled, but goes for four more...length ball outside off, takes a thickish outside edge wide of second slip and third man is too wide
similar spot, outside off, left alone this time
worked from off stump into midwicket
full at off stump, defended to cover
full at middle and leg, punched with terrific timing wide of mid-on and it races away
full outside off, 137kph, left alone
skewed in the air over the off side, away from the fielders, but that was a false stroke
short of a length down the leg side, goes for the pull and it glances off the thigh pad to long leg
he flays another! A full delivery outside off and he throws the kitchen sink at a lofted drive over cover, ends up being a one-handed stroke
and another! Third man was briefly interested, but it was wide of it. Guptill throws his hands through a length delivery outside off and it flies off a big top edge
full outside off, comes forward and plays to mid-off
back of a length, defended towards point
a tempter, full and wide outside off, swings away as Nicholls chases it with a drive
back of a length, driven onto the covers
fuller outside off, played with an open face on the front foot and it gets through backward point
miles over fine leg! A short ball down the leg side, Guptill catches up with it and swings it well back beyond the boundary
a short one down the leg side to start with
short of a length on leg stump, takes the thigh pad backward of square
well bowled! Back of a length outside off, 137kph, and comes back sharply as Guptill leaves it alone

big swing, edged, caught behind! Guptill isn't sure and he's called the review. Pretty sure I heard a noise. It was back of a length and straight, Guptill had a huge wind up, aiming out of the ground again...and there's a clear spike
that's a ripper! 141kph, good length, angled across outside off, zips past Conway's edge and also bursts through Rahim's gloves.
short of a length at middle and leg, 140kph, thuds into the thigh pad. Good wheels from Ahmed
good length outside off, left alone
full at off stump, confidently driven to mid-off
full outside off, hint of swing, a very well-timed punch square through the off side to get off the mark
full, pushed down the leg side, a diving take from Rahim
back of a length at off stump, defended
full at off stump, 134kph, Conway gets across and defends to cover
tight to middle and off, played to the on side
well bowled, good length at off stump, defended
full at off stump, 138kph, driven to mid-off
back of a length at middle and off, gets an inside edge into the pads
just past Ahmed's right hand! Punched in the air straight down the pitch, Ahmed can't get to it. Pulls up short of the boundary
full on the pads, flicked strongly through square leg
full outside off, 141kph, left alone...and that's a no-ball
a sharp bouncer, Nicholls misses the pull and gets the wide call so the free hit carries over (was actually changed to another no-ball)
full at the stumps, basically just a heave across the line from Nicholls as he sends it through midwicket
edged, wide of the slips...full outside off, draws the drive, probably went through around fourth slip to third man
round the wicket, punches a full delivery to mid-on
plays forward and gets a thick inside edge to the leg side
good length at off stump, defended
blocked with bat and pad together
worked off the pads, neatly placed through midwicket
a shorter delivery, punched into the covers
full outside off, driven into the covers and mid-off gets across
back of a length at off stump, 141kph, gets a thick inside edge as he defends
full outside off, skids through to the keeper
a flowing drive from Conway but it's intercepted at cover
angled across full outside off, left alone
short outside off, latches on with a pull and gets it through midwicket
full at off stump, nudged into the covers
length and down leg side, looks for the sweep, misses, might have got bat on the roundabout but it drops wide of the lunging keeper
length at leg stump, pushed into the leg side
short of a length outside off, punched firmly to cover off the back foot
full on off stump, driven with the turn to long-off
length and skidding on to the stumps, patted to midwicket with the angle
full at middle stump, can't get the straight drive away. Thick inside edge to mid-on's left
rips through him! Lands this one the seam at a good length, it jags back in viciously and climbs over off stump after beating his inside edge on the cover drive
length at off stump, defended into the covers
length on off stump, punched on the up to mid-off
short of a length in the corridor, turned into the leg side with soft hands
length in the corridor, dead-batted into the leg side
full at leg stump, flicked to midwicket
length outside off, steps out and is beaten in flight. Forced to defend
length at middle stump, patted down the pitch off the back foot
tossed up at middle stump, checks his drive, back to the bowler
full at middle stump, driven to long-on
length at middle, punched to long-on off the back foot
short and wide outside off, punched to long-off's right

mix up but misfield. Conway safe in the end. Full on off stump, driven to cover's right and he's ball watching as Nicholls runs through. Fielder doesn't gather cleanly though and he gets time to make it
full on middle stump, driven on the bounce to the bowler
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper's left
length on leg stump, flicked to short fine's right
full on off stump, driven to long-off
length outside off, mistimed punch towards mid-on
short and just outside off, cut to sweeper
good length and turning away from off, pushed with the turn towards backward point
full at off stump, driven to long-off
short and just outside off, cut firmly to sweeper's left
full at off stump, driven to long-off
length on off stump, pushed into the covers off the back foot
short outside off, cut to sweeper point
full on leg stump, driven down to long-on
tossed up outside off, driven to long-off
short of a length at off stump, punched to cover, won't run on the misfield
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
back of a length at middle stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
length and sliding onto the pads, can't get his whip away
short of a length on middle, punched to long-on's right off the back foot
length and into middle, pushed to midwicket's right
full on off stump, pushed back to the bowler
short and just outside off, backs away and spanks it to sweeper's left and Taskin there gets in a tangle and lets that through
length at middle stump, waits on that and clips to deep square
length and just outside off, inside edge towards midwicket as he gets forward to block
length at middle stump, blocked on the front foot

full at middle stump, stands tall and punches firmly to mid-on's right. Fielder decides to chase instead of putting in a dive and loses the race. Conway has his first boundary in a scratchy debut innings
short at the ribs, pulls it into the floor, between deep square and fine leg. Mahmudullah slides to his left to keep it in
short and climbing over off stump, left alone
length and into leg stump, clipped to backward square's right off the back foot
full on off stump, blocked on the front foot
full on off stump, tapped back to the bowler
short of a length just outside off, tapped towards point off the back foot
length and sliding in at off stump, defended into the covers off the back foot
length outside off, inside edge onto pad as he looks to block on the front foot
length on off stump, soft-handed push to mid-off to steal a run
length and across the corridor, has a poke and is beaten
short of a length across the corridor, hangs the bat out and is beaten again
crunched! Full and wide outside off, reaches out for it and drills it on the up to extra cover's left
short of a length at leg stump, pushed into the leg side off the back foot

chipped to deep square.Looks to walk down at this length ball and loft it over the infield. Is forced to reach out and closes the face as a result. Floats harmlessly out to Mahmudullah and he takes it. Scratchy from Conway today, not one of his better days
short of a length outside off, steered to third man
short of a length outside off, punched to sweeper's left
length outside off, shuffles and defends
length and wobbly outside off, looks to drive on the rise and gets a thick edge to third man
length outside off, punched on the up to sweeper cover
full and curving away outside off, a sumptuous square drive to find sweeper
short of a length and just outside off, waits on it and opens the face for the late cut. Third man is very wide and can't stop this to his left, after a good tumbling effort
stylish pull to get New Zealand 1-0 up. Short of a length at off and middle, watches that on nicely as he pivots and makes sweet connection on the pull behind square
